isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - KEY SWITCH CYLINDER

svcprocinfo.para: The door locks and the ignition key switch are coded differently so that two separate keys operate the ignition switch and door locks. The code number is stamped on the key switch body just in back of the cap nut. The code number does not appear on the door lock assembly.
To locate the code number on the key switch, remove the key switch mounting cap nut and remove the key switch from the instrument panel.
At customer request, the key switch and door locks can be coded the same so that one key operates both key switch and door lock cylinders.

step1.para: The ignition key switch is located to the left of the driver in the dash panel below the instrument panel on both the 5000 and 9000 models. Remove the key switch as follows.

On 9100, 9200, 9300, and 9400 models only, remove the push-in fasteners and screws and remove the trim panel ( Item 1, Figure 24) from the bottom of the dash panel ( Item 2, Figure 24) to the bulkhead and the left side trim panel ( Item 3, Figure 24) to allow room to reach in behind the dash panel.
Unscrew mounting cap nut ( Item 4, Figure 24) and remove it from the key switch ( Item 5, Figure 24).
Reach up behind the dash panel ( Item 1, Figure 25) and pull the key switch ( Item 2, Figure 25) down and out of the dash panel.

figure.caption: Figure 25. Pull Key Switch Out of Dash Panel

step1.para: Disconnect the electrical connector ( Item 1, Figure 26) from the back of the key switch ( Item 2, Figure 26) and remove from the vehicle.

Insert the ignition key ( Item 1, Figure 27) into the key switch ( Item 2, Figure 27) and rotate counterclockwise to accessory position, so that the key is lined up with the release hole ( Item 3, Figure 27) in the key switch body.

figure.caption: Figure 27. Line Up Key With Release Hole

step1.para: Insert a 1/16 inch (1.6 mm) diameter rod (paper clip) ( Item 1, Figure 28) into the release hole in the key switch body of the key switch ( Item 2, Figure 28) and depress switch cylinder retainer. Pull the complete switch cylinder ( Item 1, Figure 29) from the key switch body ( Item 2, Figure 29).

figure.caption: Figure 28. Insert 1/16 Inch Diameter Rod into Release Hole
Figure 29. Pull Switch Cylinder From Key Switch Body

note.para: If the vehicle keys are lost, drill out the switch cylinder. Using a 5/16 inch (8 mm) drill bit, drill 1/2 to 3/4 inch (12.7 to 19 mm) deep. This will permit the tumblers to drop out and free the switch cylinder.

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: If the original key is desired when replacing the ignition key switch cylinder, code the new key switch accordingly. Use the following steps:

step1.para: Insert the original key in the new switch cylinder (before insertion into the switch body) ( Figure 30). File off the tumblers that protrude from the cylinder. Make certain that no burrs are left on the tumblers, and that all filings are blown out with compressed air.

figure.caption: Figure 30. Insert Original Key in New Switch Cylinder

step1.para: To re-install the same cylinder, or to install a new cylinder, apply a small quantity of powdered graphite to the tumblers, then insert the ignition key ( Item 3, Figure 29) into the switch cylinder. Rotate counterclockwise to accessory position and insert switch cylinder back into the key switch body. Rotate the key to the off position and remove the key.
Position the key switch at the dash panel and connect the electrical connector to the back of the key switch.
Position the key switch up behind the dash panel and insert it into the dash panel.
With the key switch pushed through the dash panel and positioned properly, install the mounting cap nut securing it to the dash panel. Tighten snugly.
Install the left side trim panel and the trim panel from the bottom of the dash panel to the bulkhead and secure with push-in fasteners and screws.
